00024 #ifndef GERB_FILE_H
00025 #define GERB_FILE_H
00026 
00027 #include <stdio.h>
00028 
00029 typedef struct file {
00030     FILE *fd;     /* File descriptor */
00031     int   fileno; /* The integer version of fd */
00032     char *data;   /* Pointer to data mmaped in. May not be changed, use ptr */
00033     int   datalen;/* Length of mmaped data ie file length */
00034     int   ptr;    /* Index in data where we are reading */
00035 } gerb_file_t;
00036 
00037 
00038 gerb_file_t *gerb_fopen(char *filename);
00039 int gerb_fgetc(gerb_file_t *fd);
00040 int gerb_fgetint(gerb_file_t *fd, int *len); /* If len != NULL, returns number
00041                                           of chars parsed in len */
00042 double gerb_fgetdouble(gerb_file_t *fd);
00043 char *gerb_fgetstring(gerb_file_t *fd, char term);
00044 void gerb_ungetc(gerb_file_t *fd);
00045 void gerb_fclose(gerb_file_t *fd);
00046 
00047 extern
00048 const char path_separator;
00049 
00050 /*
00051  * Search for files in directories pointed out by paths, a NULL terminated
00052  * list of directories to search. If a string in paths starts with a $, then
00053  * characters to / (or string end if no /) is interpreted as a environment
00054  * variable.
00055  */
00056 char *gerb_find_file(char *filename, char **paths);
00057 
00058 #endif /* GERB_FILE_H */
